AI Governance Concepts.label: AI Governance
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Frameworks and policies for overseeing responsible AI development and deployment

AI Governance Concepts.label: Algorithmic Bias
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Systematic unfairness in AI outputs affecting certain populations disproportionately

AI Governance Concepts.label: Deterministic AI
AI Governance Concepts.definition: AI systems producing consistent, predictable outputs for given inputs

AI Governance Concepts.label: Explainability
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Capability of AI systems to provide understandable rationale for their outputs

AI Governance Concepts.label: AI Bill of Materials
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Comprehensive inventory of AI system components, data sources, and dependencies

AI Governance Concepts.label: Contestability
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Ability for affected parties to challenge and seek review of AI-driven decisions

AI Governance Concepts.label: Decision Provenance
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Traceable record of inputs, models, and processes leading to AI-generated decisions

AI Governance Concepts.label: Human-in-the-Loop
AI Governance Concepts.definition: AI design requiring human review or approval before actions are taken

AI Governance Concepts.label: Model Cards
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Documentation describing AI model characteristics, performance, and limitations

AI Governance Concepts.label: Model Drift
AI Governance Concepts.definition: Degradation of AI model performance over time due to changing data patterns

AI Technologies and Systems.label: Clinical AI
AI Technologies and Systems.definition: Artificial intelligence systems designed for use in healthcare delivery settings

AI Technologies and Systems.label: AI-Enabled Medical Devices
AI Technologies and Systems.definition: Medical devices incorporating artificial intelligence for diagnosis or treatment

AI Technologies and Systems.label: Agentic AI
AI Technologies and Systems.definition: Autonomous AI systems capable of independent decision-making and action

AI Technologies and Systems.label: Clinical Decision Support
AI Technologies and Systems.definition: AI tools providing clinicians with knowledge and patient-specific information for decisions

AI Technologies and Systems.label: Predictive Risk Scores
AI Technologies and Systems.definition: AI-generated assessments predicting patient health outcomes or risks

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: Data Security
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Protection of health data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: Asset Inventory
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Comprehensive catalog of IT systems and devices in a healthcare organization

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: CTEM
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Continuous Threat Exposure Management, ongoing security vulnerability assessment approach

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: Network Security
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Protection of computer networks from intrusion and unauthorized access

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: Prompt Injection
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Attack technique manipulating AI systems through malicious input prompts

Cybersecurity Concepts.label: REIS
Cybersecurity Concepts.definition: Relevant Electronic Information Systems under HIPAA security requirements

Data and Privacy Concepts.label: Privacy by Design
Data and Privacy Concepts.definition: Approach embedding privacy protections into system architecture from inception

Data and Privacy Concepts.label: Patient Consent
Data and Privacy Concepts.definition: Authorization from patients for use of their health information

Data and Privacy Concepts.label: Data Pipelines
Data and Privacy Concepts.definition: Automated processes for collecting, processing, and delivering data to AI systems

Data and Privacy Concepts.label: Data Stewardship
Data and Privacy Concepts.definition: Responsible management and oversight of health data assets

Emerging Concepts.label: Deflationary AI
Emerging Concepts.definition: AI deployment approach designed to reduce costs and administrative burden

Emerging Concepts.label: Gold Card Mechanisms
Emerging Concepts.definition: Expedited approval processes for providers meeting quality criteria

Emerging Concepts.label: Hub-and-Spoke Architecture
Emerging Concepts.definition: Distributed system design with central coordination and local delivery points

Emerging Concepts.label: Trial-First Pathways
Emerging Concepts.definition: Approach prioritizing clinical trial matching before standard authorization

Emerging Concepts.label: Workforce Readiness Telemetry
Emerging Concepts.definition: Proposed interoperability concept for predicting clinical capacity degradation

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: HHS
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Department of Health and Human Services, primary federal agency overseeing health policy and programs
terms: Department of Health and Human Services

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: ONC
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology within HHS
terms: Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: CMS
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, administers federal healthcare programs
terms: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: FDA
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Food and Drug Administration, regulates medical devices including AI-enabled devices

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: OMB
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Office of Management and Budget, issues federal policy memoranda including AI guidance

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: CIO/ONS
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Chief Information Officer and Office of National Security within HHS

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: OCR
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Office for Civil Rights within HHS, enforces HIPAA and health privacy regulations

Federal Agencies and Offices.label: OGA
Federal Agencies and Offices.definition: Office of Global Affairs within HHS, handles international health policy coordination

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: Electronic Health Records
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Digital systems for storing and managing patient health information

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: FHIR
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, standard for exchanging healthcare data electronically

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: Interoperability
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Ability of health IT systems to exchange and use electronic health information

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: Bulk Data Access
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Capability to export large volumes of health data for analysis and AI training

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: EBMonFHIR
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Evidence Based Medicine on FHIR Implementation Guide for clinical evidence sharing

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: USCDI
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: United States Core Data for Interoperability, standardized health data elements
terms: United States Core Data for Interoperability

Health IT Standards and Interoperability.label: mCODE
Health IT Standards and Interoperability.definition: Minimal Common Oncology Data Elements, standard for cancer data interoperability

Healthcare Administrative Processes.label: ONC Certification
Healthcare Administrative Processes.definition: Federal certification program for health IT products meeting standards

Healthcare Administrative Processes.label: Resource Allocation
Healthcare Administrative Processes.definition: Distribution of healthcare resources across patients and services

Healthcare Administrative Processes.label: Fraud Prevention
Healthcare Administrative Processes.definition: Activities to detect and prevent healthcare fraud, waste, and abuse

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Clinical Workflow
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Sequence of tasks and processes in delivering patient care

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Patient Safety
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Prevention of errors and adverse effects in healthcare delivery

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Care Coordination
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Organization of patient care activities across multiple providers and settings

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Health Equity
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Fair opportunity for all individuals to attain their full health potential

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Clinical Trials
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Research studies testing medical interventions in human participants

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Longitudinal Patient Data
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Complete patient health information collected over time across care settings

Healthcare Delivery Concepts.label: Shared Decision Making
Healthcare Delivery Concepts.definition: Collaborative process where clinicians and patients make healthcare decisions together

Healthcare Programs.label: Medicare
Healthcare Programs.definition: Federal health insurance program primarily for people 65 and older

Healthcare Programs.label: Medicare Mobile App
Healthcare Programs.definition: Proposed interactive mobile application for Medicare beneficiaries and providers

Healthcare Programs.label: Value-Based Care Models
Healthcare Programs.definition: Payment models that reward quality outcomes rather than service volume

Healthcare Stakeholders.label: Healthcare Providers
Healthcare Stakeholders.definition: Individuals and organizations delivering medical care to patients

Healthcare Stakeholders.label: Healthcare Organizations
Healthcare Stakeholders.definition: Institutions providing healthcare services including hospitals and clinics

Healthcare Stakeholders.label: Payers
Healthcare Stakeholders.definition: Entities that finance or reimburse healthcare services

Healthcare Stakeholders.label: Sponsors
Healthcare Stakeholders.definition: Organizations funding clinical trials, typically pharmaceutical or device companies

Medical Specialties.label: Dermatology
Medical Specialties.definition: Medical specialty focused on skin conditions and diseases

Medical Specialties.label: Neurosurgery
Medical Specialties.definition: Surgical specialty focused on the nervous system

Medical Specialties.label: Oncology
Medical Specialties.definition: Medical specialty focused on cancer diagnosis and treatment

Policy and Strategy Documents.label: HHS AI Strategy
Policy and Strategy Documents.definition: Department-wide strategic plan for artificial intelligence adoption and governance

Policy and Strategy Documents.label: RIN 0955-AA13
Policy and Strategy Documents.definition: Regulation Identifier Number for the AI in clinical care RFI

Professional Associations.label: ACHE
Professional Associations.definition: American College of Healthcare Executives, professional society for healthcare leaders

Professional Associations.label: CHiME
Professional Associations.definition: College of Healthcare Information Management Executives, association for health IT leaders
terms: College of Healthcare Information Management Executives

Professional Associations.label: Connecticut Hospital Association
Professional Associations.definition: State-level hospital trade association in Connecticut

Professional Associations.label: HIMSS
Professional Associations.definition: Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society, health IT professional organization
terms: Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society

Professional Associations.label: HL7
Professional Associations.definition: Health Level Seven International, standards development organization for health IT

Regulations and Legal Frameworks.label: Request for Information
Regulations and Legal Frameworks.definition: Formal solicitation for public input on policy matters before rulemaking

Regulations and Legal Frameworks.label: OMB Memorandum M-25-21
Regulations and Legal Frameworks.definition: Federal policy memorandum addressing AI governance and asset inventory requirements

Regulations and Legal Frameworks.label: HIPAA
Regulations and Legal Frameworks.definition: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act governing health data privacy and security
terms: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

Regulations and Legal Frameworks.label: Liability Framework
Regulations and Legal Frameworks.definition: Legal structure defining responsibility and accountability for AI-related harms

Regulations and Legal Frameworks.label: Prior Authorization
Regulations and Legal Frameworks.definition: Approval process required before certain healthcare services are covered

Research and Evidence Concepts.label: Bioethics
Research and Evidence Concepts.definition: Study of ethical issues arising from advances in biology and medicine

Research and Evidence Concepts.label: Implementation Science
Research and Evidence Concepts.definition: Study of methods to promote adoption of evidence-based practices

Research and Evidence Concepts.label: Real-World Evidence
Research and Evidence Concepts.definition: Clinical evidence derived from real-world healthcare data outside clinical trials

Research and Evidence Concepts.label: Systematic Review
Research and Evidence Concepts.definition: Comprehensive synthesis of research evidence on a specific question
